data.title: Sao Tome and Principe
data.text:
ã

ããSao Tome and Principe

ããï¼Updated February 2018ï¼

ãããOfficial NameãDemocratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe

ãããAreaã1,001 km2

ãããPopulationã204,000; 90% of the population is Bantu, the rest being mixed-race. 90% of the residents believe in Catholicism.

ãããCapitalãSao Tome and Principe, with a population of about 65,000

ãããHead of StateãPresident Evaristo Carvalho (since September 2016)

ãããHolidayãIndependence Day (12 July); Army Day (6 September)

ãããGeography and ClimateãBeing an island country in the southeast of the Gulf of Guinea in central-western Africa, Sao Tome and Principe is 201 km off the African continent. It is composed of two main islands: Sao tome and Principe, and 14 small islands. It has Gabon to the east and Equatorial Guinea to the northeast across the sea. Its coastline is 220 km long. Both Sao Tome and Principe are volcanic islands. The Country has tropical rainforest climate, and is wet and hot all the year round. The average temperature of the two islands is 27â. The long rains season is from January to May, the dry season from June to September, and the short rains season from October to December. The average annual rainfall is 1,000 to 2,500 mm.
